column5: The anicut that was built across the mahakekela oya and the irrigation canal that carried that water have been destroyed. This 500m long canal has provided water to 18 acres of paddy fields.
column6: Removing debries and clearing the site
Construction of 1.2 m high Weir across stream excluding abutments and stop planks
Construction of 1.8m high 1:3:6 (40mm) cement concrete Retaining Wall
75mm tk. Stop planks (kumbuk ) with 10mm dia. 2nos. M. S. Iron hooks and applies 2 coats of hot tar.

Supply & install of 300 mm CI gate complete set including Spindle, Housing, Base plate, Closing plate, Key, Brass nut, and other required accessories. (This rate is excluding of transport of materials)

Vegetative cover improving around structures (5m x 10m) with planting Arecanut seedling in 1.5m x 1.5m grid, and planting Kumbuk/ Mee/ Godapara/ Kaduru/ Aththikka/ Wal Del/ Kekuna/ randomly mixed seedlings in 3.5m x 3.5 m grid
